Description: Neck sherd of Attic black-figured pottery neck-amphora; interior: glazed black with wide added red band above junction with shoulder; exterior: incised opposed lotus and palmette chain; two dilute lines below; raised fillet at junction with shoulder.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Munich 1439 in Mommsen, H., Der Affecter. Mainz 1975, pl. 13, no.105.
For the Affecter at Naukratis see also A. Johnston, 'Some fictile biographies from Naukratis', in D.C. Kurtz (ed.), Essays in Classical Archaeology for Eleni Hatzivassiliou, Oxford 2008, 115.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 37)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 245, no. B134)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 234, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0036) (Phase 1)
